title: Charles Batsaikhan - Resume
text:
Project Experience
Opioid Epidemic - Intermediate Data Science

Led a team in developing a Shiny web application using R to analyze and visualize the U.S. opioid epidemic.
Applied R and Shiny for data manipulation, cleaning, and interactive visualization, showcasing demographic impacts.
Employed API web scraping techniques to gather diverse datasets, enhancing the depth and breadth of the analysis.

Powerlifting Dataset - Statistical Machine Learning

Used R programming to answer how accurately machine learning algorithms identify the best models to predict kilograms lifted by competitors.
Used LASSO and Splines Models in a Regression setting, and Logistic Regression and Decision Trees in a Classification setting.
Best models: LASSO in the Regression setting, and Logistic Regression in the Classification setting.

Double Down - Object Oriented Programming

Used Java programming to work in group settings and create a user interactive Blackjack card game.

title: Charles Batsaikhan - Resume
text:
Work Experience
Preceptor for “Intro to Data Science” course, Macalester College

Teacher’s assistant; graded students’ homework and quizzes efficiently and accurately.
Helped teach many students with no prior R coding experience while holding office hours.
Taught students the importance of data importing, wrangling, and visualizing using ggplot and dplyr package of R.

Campus Center Building Manager, Macalester College

Managed operations of the Campus Center and other main buildings on the campus.
Helped organize campus center events being hosted by the college.

Summer Intern - Accounting, Kokua Kalihi Valley-Health Center, Honolulu, HI

Entered journal entries of company transactions on MIP Fund Accounting software.
Improved skills in MS Office, specifically Excel Spreadsheets by running the company’s monthly expense summaries.
Created PowerPoint instructions on the usage of various office equipment.

title: Analyzing the Opioid Epidemic
text: You can explore the Opioid Epidemic ShinyApp (link will be added). You can explore the source code here

title: Analyzing the Opioid Epidemic
text:
Introduction
In this project, my group mates and I delve into the critical issue of the opioid epidemic, employing data analysis techniques and interactive visualizations to understand its impact and identify potential patterns.

title: Analyzing the Opioid Epidemic
text:
Objectives

Data Exploration: Dive into datasets related to opioid usage, overdose incidents, and associated factors.
Trend Analysis: Identify temporal trends and geographical patterns to better comprehend the evolution of the epidemic.
Interactive Visualizations: Utilize R and RShiny to create dynamic visualizations for enhanced data exploration.

title: Analyzing the Opioid Epidemic
text:
Methodology
I approach the analysis with a combination of statistical methods and data visualization tools. Leveraging the power of R and RShiny, I aim to provide an insightful perspective on the opioid epidemic.

title: Analyzing the Opioid Epidemic
text:
Expected Outcomes
Through this project, I anticipate shedding light on the opioid epidemic’s dynamics, contributing valuable insights that may inform future interventions and policies.

Macalester College | St. Paul, MN B.A in Data Science  minor in Math| Sept 2021 - May 2025 (Expected)



Hello! I’m Charles Batsaikhan, a third-year Data Science student at Macalester College. Originally from Honolulu, Hawaii, and raised in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. I enjoy TV time with friends, swimming, and watching mixed martial arts.



I believe Data Scientists are crucial because they possess the ability to predict the outcomes of events using data. This aligns with my passion for creating a better society for everyone. My goal is to become a proficient data scientist, utilizing my skills to contribute to societal improvement by predicting outcomes through the technical expertise required in this field.
As an enthusiastic Data Science student, I have a strong foundation in statistical analysis, machine learning, data importing and wrangling, spatial and non-spatial visualization, and database management. My technical skills include coding in R, Python, SQL, and Java.
